_WAQ-rgGU_RDyAibKL6Asw.text: Just a stone's throw away from Old Street Tube station, Thai Thai East is conveniently located on the Old Street, and hard to miss. The interior decor is interestingly vibrant, and reminds me a little of Thai Square, altho with less of the pomp. Our group of six diners ordered A LOT of food for this meal. It was a farewell dinner for one of our friends who was visiting from abroad, and we were all hungry. Sadly, I cannot rave about most of the dishes at this restaurant: Starters The Thai Thai Platter is great for sharing, and decent enough in taste, but hardly impressive (if you're a cynic like me, you'd know you can get these frozen from Wing Yip and they'd taste exactly the same, if not better). Thai salads like Som Tham (papaya salad) were bland and a huge disappointment - rather pricey, if you think about how bland it tastes! The Larb (minced chicken salad) was decent, and by far the best salad dish available. Don't bother ordering the seafood salad - it's practically the worst I've ever had, with no hint of vermicelli whatsoever, and a strong overdose of onions. They've got the equation all wrong! Soup We ordered the Po-Tak (min for 2), which was well presented in a little steamboat with a flame under it, to keep the soup warm. Although the portions says it's for 2, do not be deceived - we could not finish it, even though there were 6 of us! It's not a bad soup.. much like Tom Yum, but truly.. it is quite bland. We all agreed we'd had much better elsewhere. But if you want to order group soup, then this is probably the most economical way to do it.. (£10.95) and you'll have left-overs, rather than order individual portions at £4.95. We ordered quite a selection of main courses since we were all hungry, and curious to sample what the restaurant had to offer. Beef: Sau Rong Hai (Weeping Tiger), a grilled beef dish is supposed to be moist and tender, but this came out dry and tough. Duck:We ordered one duck dish which also turned out rather dry and tough, and portions were small. Green Curry: It's almost impossible to go wrong with green curry.. so, we ordered a Chicken Green Curry.. nice enough, but again, no wow factor there. As expected, it was decent. Seafood: However, I'd highly recommend ordering the red curry River Prawns, as the prawns are huge and succulent (forget ordinary prawns.. you seldom get prawns this big in other restaurants!)... Fish dishes were very good - we order Choo Chee sea bass (funnily enough, all their fish dishes were sea bass), and another steamed fish with lime & spicy sauce (this was excellent, and by far the best dish). Phad Thai: If you love Phad Thai, then I strongly recommend you order it at this restaurant - it has got to be the best Phad Thai I've had in a long while - the noodles are moist yet not soggy, and the flavours are just right. Most restaurants do their Phad Thai too dry, and the noodles tend to stick together else, they're too soggy. I'd go back to this restaurant just for the Phad Thai, but probably nothing else.. Prices are not cheap at Thai Thai East - we managed to get a deal on Toptable which gave us 50% off for food, but that does not include drinks or desserts, and these can severely add on to your bill, even if you're a non-alcoholic drinker. In the end, we paid £21 each for the meal, which, without the Top Table offer would have probably come closer to £35 each. Not exactly good quality for such a meal I will not be rushing back to Thai Thai East, not unless someone organized a dinner get-together, but even then.. I'd be reluctant to spend my money there. There are better Thai restaurants out there which won't cost you an arm and a leg for very mediocre food.

m4njZPgejrN6MhQZO6NV7g.text: I took the opportunity to use some of my toptable points at the Thai Thai East, which made it a very cheap evening, having said that looking at the menu the value for money would have been good even if paying for it. As for the food itself, the two dishes I had were good, the green curry was very nice, although the salad on the side was more of an after thought and not the freshest I have ever seen, but that is forgivable as the curry was the thing I was eating. The decor was what I imagined would be quite Thai and interesting and although I was there very early on a Tuesday, I can imagine that it would be quite a good place for a group of friends a little later in the evening.

pExJgroMOgojAI-eaBIG4A.text: I get takeaway from here, red curries or penangs. Perfectly acceptable.

5FHC3a6BnVBPCN042QEfqQ.text: Absolutely love this place! Thai Thai East has great hospital employees who are very friendly. If its busy can be a wait for your courses but worth the wait! Thai green curry is delicious. They do lovely sauces too

YUcFhkQISVBhgeIJrpQhxQ.text: Have eaten here for a big family lunch including grandparents (group of 12) using a toptable (toptable.co.uk/thai-thai…) 50% discount offer which they are currently running till 7 July 2012. You have to order a starter and main course for each diner and in exchange it is half price. 24 dishes so we did a good sampling of the menu. I get the feeling that most diners are there on some sort of deal  its always busy whenever I wander by which is frequently. Despite the good reviews I think the food here is ordinary at best  bland and the batter fried dishes were frankly poor  takes a lot for the kids to turn their noses up at deep fried soft shell crab or squid  but they did. Curries too sweet, not enough heat. I wouldn't go back despite the cheapness  maybe its just me but i really cannot recommend a single Thai restaurant in Shoreditch and the includes Busaba Eathai (qype.co.uk/place/1572273…) and Yelo (qype.co.uk/place/86152-Y…) guess I must be fussy..

K7_MHu2AFamWMtDRv-mo9g.text: Thai Thai -East was a nicely laid-out restaurant, pleasant service and enjoyable food (but curries slightly too sweet for our tastes though).

Wf8zYHWfXuy5C849TmaqnA.text: Went here on a free Toptable meal. To start I ordered the tom yam gai (described on the menu as "The famous Thai spicy and sour chicken with lemon grass and fresh herbs soup"). The chicken in my soup was incredibly tender - often you get overcooked chicken in soups, but this tasted like it had been delicately poached and then added to the soup for serving. For the main I chose phad ke moe chicken, which is "stir fried flat rice noodles with holy basil leaves and chili" - it came packed with more chicken and veggies than noodles. Man, they were not kidding about the chili. The menu has two red chilies next to this dish, which means it is hot, but it was really making my whole mouth numb.

DuszyclXbirhxOQJZenwiw.text: Book if you want to go here it was rammed at 7pm on a sun night. Let's start with the positives. The decor is lovely and the service is smiley and efficient. We ordered on the tptable 50% offer, bear in mind that you need to order a starter and main each on this deal which is more food than I wanted. The starters of thai fishcakes and duck spring rolls tasted fresh and were filled with meat rather than cheap filler such as beansprouts. Sadly it went a bit downhill from there. The curries all tasted a bit sickly sweet as though they had been finished with pure sugar. Normally I love the balance between sweet, sour, hot and salty in thai food but here everything just tasted sweet, so much so that I felt a bit ill after eating it. We ordered 5 different curries so I don't think this was bad luck or bad ordering. I would probably wouldn't go back.

hpxgnS4VeAG_hbrC6XUAFQ.text: Thai Thai offers quality and tasty food for an affordable price. The atmosphere is quite nice, although it can sometime be rather noisy on weekends. During the week it offers an almost romantic setting. The chairs are quite worn out, and would need to be replaced. Despite that I would definitely recommend the restaurant.

YaRZdOyiH7QtPVy8u656dA.text: Used to go here at least once a week (especially with Tastecard) but the food has slipped to the point of greasily unpleasant. It's a shame as the vibe is nice and the floor staff always treated us like regulars. Sedap next door has Malaysian food that tastes a hell of a lot more fresh.

55w0TGUkzHR_CTLzqP9qzA.text: Love the yellow curry, plus one course at lunch is just £6.95, or takeaway with spring rolls for £5.50. Service is quick too, so it's a good place for a worktime outing.

pRpCAcDLpv-fp9YH09FgEQ.text: I am sorry to say that their standard fell dramatically after the original manager went back to Bangkok.  When we visited in November and March, the service was pretty bad - we had a rude, unfriendly waitress telling us off about the booking - not our fault - and the service in general was bad; however the food was still OK (not as good as before though).  On our visit last Sunday, the service was better, but the food worsened.  My favourite Tod Mun Pla (Fish Cake) had odd chemiacl taste/smell and was spongy and soft.  All the main course dishes were way too salty, and the rice was not properly cooked.  It used to be an excellent Thai restauant, but now it is below average.  I don't think I will go back...

i1kAFacamolVwdiB4CgE0g.text: I have eaten much better Thai food in Europe than in this place. When I asked for a second Thai iced tea, they told me they were out of it and we had ordered the last two. What kind of Thai restaurant runs out of Thai iced tea?! My friend and I split the appetizer tray for two. The chicken satay had a gross after-taste that reminded me of lighter fluid. The fish cakes were dry. For my main course, I ordered the pad see ew with beef. The whole dish was dry and bland and the beef was overcooked. For dessert, I was tempted to order one of the cakes but I had been disappointed all night so I just ordered the Chrysanthemum tea. The tea turned out to be a pleasant surprise--very refreshing and just the right amount of sweet.I would have given Thai Thai 2 stars if it wasn't for the Chrysanthemum tea.

TiITZnPnb968uvAnaic7tw.text: I go here a lot for lunch during the work week. They have a large lunch menu which is absolutely a bonus when you're looking for something a bit different every day! The lunch menu recently went down in price too (!!!). The staff are generally very attentive and the meals come out swiftly. Although there have been times when the restaurant is packed and the staff seemed to have difficulty managing this. All in all, I love good thai food and this place is great value for money. Yum!

g7pb4huJ1EfwJ_BQoXuYWQ.text: Mmm Thai....one of my very favourite things! I was really looking forward to visiting Thai Thai because its right round the corner from my new flat, and my parents (who are also Thai food fans) were in town for a visit. It would be the perfect place to take them!The restaurant itself looked very nice. It was busy on a wednesday night with low key lighting and good quality interior decor. The staff were both pretty and polite.Two of the dishes we ordered - grilled river prawns and the seafood red curry - were fantastic! Completely bowled me over!The others were very ordinary.All in all, this was not too bad an experience; saved perhaps by the prawns and the lovely service...did I mention the pretty staff?

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom

mAfcxoVVTcWwhhGnqGLDOw.text: Went here with a couple of friends using a 25% off Gourmet Society offer and enjoyed it although it was nothing out of the ordinary. The decor was lovely with authentic glasswork, wooden carvings and big windows giving a light and spacious feel and the service was friendly and attentive. Our Singapore Slings while we were deciding what to order were fruity, helped by the blackberry on top and with a decent kick. Starters of Crab, Prawns and "golden chicken parcels" were pretty good. The chicken could have had more spice for me and the Crab was described as "a bit like KFC", although I'm not sure that was entirely an insult... The enormous prawns were tender with perfectly done breadcrumbs and a melt in the mouth texture - definite winner, although probably leave the edible basket if you want to retain an appetite. Mains were a prawn green curry, River prawns in pumpkin red curry and a garlic and pepper seabass.The Green curry had a good flavour without being overpowering (although personally i prefer a bit more chilli kick) but it was lacking the small pea-aubergines. The pumpkin was nice although perhaps had a little too much bite to it and the butterflied River Prawns were tasty to begin with but had a slightly charred flavour and were very meaty which left us unable to finish them The seabass was nice if a little bit bland. Overall, it was a good meal without being outstanding, perhaps I've become too accustomed to Thai food because it's hard to be blown away by it these days but it was enjoyable none the less. It's location near Old Street is a plus though.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom

CrxwYYApgXy2re7shryf_Q.text: I can't comment for the dinner experience here, however I'm a regular diner during the lunch hour as they have a fantastic deal (£8 for starter and main). Couple this with the excellent quality of Thai food (try the green curry, it's pure yum!) and the entertainment and you have a satisfying lunch right there!

_0gnm8ouP9vUsFrOQyg-kA.text: Thai Thai is a good spot to grab some basic Thai food right on Old Street.My companion and I walked in there lastnight for a quiet Sunday dinner to close out what turned out to be an intense weekend. I called ahead for a table with my Tastecard - I love when good food comes at a 50% off discount. We got sat in the corner table of the room where we were able to take in the sexy ambiance that Thai Thai is working with. I ended up going with the Jungle Curry - a mixture of bamboo shoots, asparagus, chicken, etc. ((a great-sized portion at that) which was a great dish that got finished about two hours later while I was laying in bed. My companion got a chicken/egg/veggie fried rice plate which per usual she mowed down on. We both enjoyed our meals here - it being the second time both of us had dined here I can say that they are consistent.Service charge is automatically added to the bill - so the service can be quite slow/non existent at time - this being said, all the staff were very friendly.

rCzSqBqFqNGa8NxLkCT1uw.text: As the 2-star rating description says: "Meh. I've experienced better"The space is quite nice, but the food is rather mediocre and the service erratic. We were not satisfied with any of the dishes that we tried and we really enjoy thai food. That was just below average thai food.Service was a disaster. It took them around 45 minutes to bring the main after the starters were finished. Then the waitress came with 3 mains (for 2 people), insisting that we have also ordered a curry. We politely said no, and she replied that she will "check her order notebook" and get back to us...

akc2IloaRmppjEGsWk2rqA.text: Friendly service and sultry ambiance.Thai Thai offers great value, delicious food and a fantastic for going there with mates or dates. They often offer a 50% off deal through Top Table, so check do a quick check on there before booking.I'll be back for sure!

uZowf6q2SrreVbhavzDoyA.text: I'm still on the hunt for a Thai takeaway that tastes like Busaba. I think I'll be hunting for a while, but this is the best one I've had recently. One red beef curry, one green beef curry and rices and a scallops dish was £27, which isn't cheap in the slightest (I still don't understand why Thai food is so pricey, but I kid myself that it's healthier than Chinese), but it was really really tasty. It didn't taste of nothing but MSG. The scallops dish was weird. They were fried in batter but then in a liquid-y sauce which made that go a bit soggy. Would have been much better without the sauce and £8.95 is pricey even for scallops. Still, even with that issue it's a great little takeaway. We got delivery so I have no idea what it's like inside. But I'll order from them again.

x36hzB0NoYImbtd304yHJA.text: Because of said sucker-tendency when it comes to Thai food, I was close to giving 4-stars to this place but unfortunately for the restaurant, our table was served by a rather pushy waitress who seemed to be badgering us into ordering starter platters which we were not keen on. It was a large bunch of us but we wanted to order only two platters because several members of the group were vegetarians and had identified their own starters to order but the waitress kept insisting we should order three. We stuck our ground and got two platters and found them more than adequate! The restaurant is a fair trek from the tube stop, a good way of building an appetite. Food was served in adequate portions, dare I say, even enough in an individual portion to share across two if one is too full from starters and such. Flavours were rich and spicy and prices are good. Beware though, once the starters, wine, beer, mains and desserts are done, the prices could really start adding up, so it could even be worth considering the set menu but I can't speak for that considering I haven't ordered it myself.Good Thai food, is all I can say. Nothing to blow my mind but good enough for me to stop by again if I'm in the area.

HBPAnlqmCNBbD12kPD_n9g.text: Although the venue is decorated to be a wonderfully Authentic Thai and is very impressive to look at, to be greeted by quite a snappy lady put us on the wrong foot to start with. The pricing on the menu differed from that listed on the website for the restaurant and they appeared to have their own conditions to using the tastecard which are not published or listed anywhere on their website or front of house. So, after being berrated by the lady from front of house literally speaking down to us (in raised voice), the 5 of us very nearly leaving, we finally ordered and recieved some rather lack lustre food. Dont get me wrong, it was nice, but it was lacking in flavour that you would hope a great Thai to offer. As the two stars say above, 'Meh, Ive experienced better' and that applies to not only the food, but the service and the temperature in the whole venue! It does look pretty though!

ojpRFRC1u3mP4ZeIIRN3-w.text: This was a nice Thai restaurant where I had dinner with a colleague. There was a special for 2 people where we picked 2 starters and 2 entrees (50% off). The Satay Chicken was quite good while the Squid Tod was unimpressive. Split a Kao Pad Beef for the rice portion of the meal. The meal was quite tasty but the portions were quite small. Had the Massaman Curry and Jungle Curry in beef. Still a bit hungry after all of that food. To be honest, it wasnt really a good deal. As others have stated, the food was a bit salty. Of course, the odd thing was that they charged a 12.5% suggested gratuity. This is in a country which generally does not follow tipping conventions and service tends to lack. Dont remember my water being filled up too many times if at all. I would suggest trying some other place?

kbYFJbwx-bH3TPXEOFNHDA.text: Delicious. Quick. Spicy. Thai Thai was one of the many Thai restaurants I have tried recently and here is my take on it. I have to begin by saying I have to say that I have only ever ordered take-away and so far I have only ever had good experiences with them. Two dishes that really stuck out to me were the Pad-Thai chicken, which was really delicious and by far one of the best ones I have tried recently, as well as the Kang Panang (chicken) which was also delicious but packed quite a bit of heat, the only thing I have to complain about was that the chili's inside my Kang Panang were chopped quite large and it did not blend well into the dish, I just picked them out, but the overall flavor was so good! Also whilst ordering I did not realize that the Kang Panang did not come with a side of rice, which considering the price I paid I just assumed would be included, but there wasn't any, which was my fault for not checking. However the food was delicious and I have to say it is one of my go to places for quick delicious Thai food.

g53oV9okkMq5T6lMKxbJ1A.text: Overall the food & Service was good at Thai Thai. However I was disappointed in the Tom Kha Gai portion size for 6.95 we only received a single serving (i'm from San Francisco and this is not normal. I'm not sure what is usual in London as this is my first Thai restaurant so far). Duck curry- good, papaya salad- good, coconut rice also good. I would not use the 50% off deal again (From Toptable) as it forces you to order more food than normal for 2 people.

2Kd14Kjhk-N_MoiD8gCCLg.text: After having some pretty abysmal Thai food in London, I was happy when a friend recommended Thai Thai to me. I tried it the other night with some girlfriends and we had a lovely evening. Thai Thai has a wonderful, upscale, and somewhat romantic atmosphere and the food is great! I got the Pad Ke-Mao, a very spicy noodle dish and my friends got Pad Thai and sweet/sour chicken. We were all very pleased with our meals and my mouth was still burning for hours afterwards! The service was efficient but not very friendly, but everything came out right and promptly. Thai Thai is extremely affordable as well, especially for London. Each of our entrees were around £8, and the portions were good size too! The only complaint I have about this place is the background music: American 80's music sang by one cover artist, and the CD repeated over and over and over. Despite the bad music, Thai Thai was a pleasant experience.

OaqrgxswWkXEV2efnA8E-Q.text: Thai Thai, my oh my.My friend is about to embark on a 4 month adventure in Thailand.  Somehow my flatmate and I thought  4 months of Thai food wouldn't be sufficient enough for her to become sick of it and decided to start her trip out proper, by taking her to a Thai restaurant.  The idea was good.  The food was not.  Okay, maybe the idea wasn't good either.  My flatmate didn't get to specific about why she didn't like her food.  She simple stated, 'I always have pad kee mao at Thai restaurants, it's my default food.  This wasn't good.'  Maybe she should have changed it up this time.I, on the other hand, had green curry.  Which, might also be my default Thai restaurant food choice.  I should definitely have chosen another.  To be honest the green curry wasn't that bad.  It was a bit spicy and actually a little bland, but over all, not too bad.The service is what prompted the single-star rating.  I would have probably given this place 3 stars if they had good service.  First off, we ordered a starter.  About 7 minutes later another server came over and took our main order.  Soon after taking our main order they took away our start plates.  Please note: no where in the above paragraph did I say we received our starter.My flatmate was a little concerned about them taking away our start plates and asked the first server if he had placed the order for our superly over-priced starter.  He assured us he did.  About 10 mins later our mains came out.Once again: please notice we DID NOT receive our starter.  They eventually brought it to us but then continued to make us feel rushed.  They tried to take our plates away before we were finished, not just once, but a few times.  Granted, I can almost understand if this place is one of those sit down, eat quick, get out - type of places, but this place tried to make it seem like it was formal dining.  And to be honest, since I paid with my US bank card, it was about $30 for my meal and I only had tap water to drink, so in my eyes - it should be considered fine dining.  But, it was not.Now, if your walking down Old Street and you see this place and think, oh that looks good.  Please remember, it's over priced, mediocre, and has bad service.

lRwhS9bDhgmKHDDGB9PONg.text: Thai Thai East isn't a very honest restaurant to be honest. It's prices are pretty high as it took in account that many people who come here probably would have a Tastecard or go on Opentable to get 40% off. Dishes doesn't always come as it is, like our morning glory came as Chinese broccoli instead and they probably assumed we don't know better. They also have a problem with stocking fresh ingredients and keeping fresh ingredients fresh. It is a shame as they have a good kitchen that is capable of cooking quite flavoursome dishes but the poor ingredients let some of the dishes downIt is also one of those restaurant that looks more fancy than it really is with its large restaurant space, lush gold pillars, dark purple tablecloths and neatly folded maroon napkins giving it a good Thailand feel to it. It does set a nice atmosphere especially with the ambient music. Staff can be a bit forgetful and takes time to warm to you. Most of them look bored. Their service is adequate but they just need to smile more.Tod mun khow podThese had a satisfying bite to it. The spices were quite mild and lovely sweetness coming from the sweetcorn. Sadly the latter did not taste fresh and somehow produced a slight chewiness and stickiness that although was unusual, somehow added to the texture of the dish that some may enjoy. Came with sweet chilli sauce to add a nice zing to it.Tom Kha mushroom soup This was lovely. The perfect balance of sour, creamy and mild spices. It was fragrant with enough complexity to keep your tastebuds busy. Mushrooms were nice and fresh too.Pineapple fried rice This was probably the best dish of the evening although the pineapple shell they used to serve it in looked very old. The rice although was long grain, it was still cooked to a nice sticky consistency. I very much enjoyed the different flavours. The mild curry powder provided the slight kick whilst the raisins gave a lovely slow release of sweetness. The pineapple were chunky adding more moisture to the dish and a nice citrusy zest taking any stodginess away. Good texture coming from the silky stirred in scrambled eggs and crunchiness from the cashew nuts.Mussaman curry veg This was lovely and thick creamy. Probably not the most authentic seeing how sweet and mild it was but that doesn't say it wasn't amazing. It was very rich, good amount of spices and strong notes of coconut. The biggest problem was that the baby sweetcorn had gone off slightly setting a slight sour note when you bit into it. Could have been dangerous but we were quite lucky to be okay. The rest of the vegetables that including broccoli and carrots seemed fresh and still kept it crunchiness which was nice. Fried tofu puffs were nice to have, soaking up the curry sauce like a sponge until you bite into it. Potatoes fluffy and soft and nice contrast in texture from the crunchy toppings of peanuts.Morning GloryAdvertised as morning glory we were given Chinese broccoli. However we didn't bother with telling them as it was beautifully cook, fresh, crunchy and seasoned nicely with minced garlic and soy. An excellent stir fry but advertised very badly. Pad Kee Maow veg This lacked the essential wok energy it needed to make it an excellent dish. But the lovely flavours and textures still made it good enough to enjoy. Fresh silky ho fun against the sweet crunchy onions, carrots and green beans. It had more kick than the rest of the dishes with the fresh green and red chillies so be careful. The flavours of the tamarind added a nice sweet zest to it and it was garnished nicely with coriander.Overall I did enjoy my experience at Thai Thai East. The kitchen seems be skilled enough to produce some fine dishes and flavours and seasoning were always on par. However the restaurant is too big for what it can fill which makes the place look very dead and empty even with customers in it. They do try and make everyone sit near the window side to make it look fuller from the outside. Of course cooking vegetables that are off is not cool and mis-selling items without informing customers is not cool either, Therefore I find the place is only worth going if you have an offer as the prices don't match up to what they are offering. Don't forget to check in with Yelp to get your free prawn crackers too.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Mussaman curry veg
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Pad Kee Maow veg

vGz9dZ1zwhtDww7ZvJdyGA.text: Don't go here. They screwed up my order and then tried to blame the driver. Wish I could review the food but never tried it.

Ou1VKXOHUQYLx3y_u99flQ.text: I have been to a lot of places around Old Street and my personal favourite is ThaiThai. The decor here is pretty but it's the quality of the food that keeps me coming back for lunch. It can be a bit hit and miss (the gyoza are dry and not all that) but ThaiThai's Pad Kee Mao noodles with beef are really delicious with that basil leaf flavour! The portions are not large but the taste is more than worth it.I have had the Mee Goreng noodles with chicken as well and they were nice, but nothing hits the spot for me like the Pad Kee Mao which are delicately spiced and flavourful without being too spicy. I am not a big fan of the fishcake appetisers but some of my friends can't get enough of those either.  For weekday lunch it isn't crowded but if you are taking a lot of people, maybe make a booking.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Complimentary orange chocolate at the end of the meal- a lovely touch! And yummy too.
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Tom Yum soup with mushrooms
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Pad Kee Mao with beef

uVIvc_mAPEpgsE8mA435Tw.text: Authentic Thai food. Great lunch location for people who work around the area.Good value for £6.9 for one course and £9.9 for two course meal. Tried their calamari and satay chicken, both good but the portion is slightly small.Also tried the Massman curry with chicken, very Thai flavour and I like the fact that you can taste the hint of coconut milk added.Will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Massman curry chicken
Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. Thai deep fried calamari

K4kqrHqDw3yeOUINee84Ag.text: I ordered traditional Thai fried rice but disappointed. Not tasting good enough. And also the coupon on the yelp cannot be used in the restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. pineapple fried rice

5CSAIBofoepqjfGed6HlAA.text: Ordered a takeaway - Masammum curry and jasmine rice.I have never had a bad masammum before but well first time for everything.I am not sure how the other dishes are and would not try to find out either.

24s0K7dTS0oFDHB3G9GiMg.text: We still only get takeaway here, but I've ordered enough dishes now to have a better grip on what's good.  The short answer is: the Tom Yum soup and the curries are 5-star-worthy, although the level of heat is variable, and sometimes the Tom Yum is nuclear hot rather than pleasantly tingly.  The noodles and stir fries aren't as good, maybe 3 stars.  I HATE how much they charge for basic Jasmine rice to go with the curry, to the point where I sometimes make it myself when I'm ordering from them.  And I'm not a huge fan of how many hoops I have to jump through to get decent prices - at the moment, it involves Topcashback to HungryHouse to these guys to get about 20ish% off their otherwise quite high prices.  But the Massaman and red curries are the best I've found around here so far, so I'm sticking with them until I find an alternative.

iBYkjz74aVAd56FBmf-WYQ.text: Excellent place, get the squid for starters, the batter on this is amazing :) the Curry has great flavours, the mango champagne drink is worth trying I quite enjoyed it! For sure a place to go again

p8bTHA9d2UE1jcfYb-QW6A.text: The  location  and  set  up is  nice  but food  was  I was  very disappointed. Never  ever  go  there  don't  order  the  fish  it's  not  even  fresh.  Everything  about  what  we  had in  this  place  was so  unpleasant . Don't  waste  your money  eating  out  at  this  place  it's  not  worth  paying  the  money. Fantastic  location  though  too  bad  about  the food.

s3vOVzWG7RvdR3S_qYy3rA.text: Ordinarily I reserve 1-star reviews for restaurants that deliberately spite me, but there was just so much 'meh' here tonight that I feel it is deserved...First, the only reason this place is packed is because it takes over 2 hours to eat here on a Friday night.  First, 20 minutes to get a waiter, 10 minutes to get drinks, 20 minutes more to get appetizers, 45 minutes more to get mains, then you've got to eat them before trying to get someone's attention again to pay for it all.  It was ridiculously slow.Then, the prices: Why should Thai food be dramatically more expensive than Indian?  I don't see why it should be.  Thai's way easier to cook, and cheaper to make.  To charge someone £3 for plain, white rice when they've already paid £10 for an entree is ridiculous - Especially when a 12.5% service charge will be added next!Lastly, the selection of food, and the execution of that food, was simply average.  There wasn't anything on the menu I hadn't seen a thousand times before.  And the preparations are exactly as one would expect, with no frills or impressive garnishes.  In the end, I was just happy dinner was over and we could get some fresh air outside (it was warm in there!).  I'm pretty sure no one in our party will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Thai - London, United Kingdom. The place mats weren't even big enough for the food plates - Let alone for keeping the silverware off the textured tables!

853sLgtRqNwRgsnmUf5SWQ.text: Called into Thai Thai at about half 7 on a Saturday night and managed to get a table for 4 with no hanging about at all. Normally this would set some alarm bells ringing for me but beggars can't be choosers.The food was a bit hit and miss. We got the veggie and meat sharer platters between the 4 of us and everything was just a little bit samey. All the food was beige and deep fried and not particularly tasty. Definitely stick to individual things if you are extra hungry (avoid the fishcakes entirely though).The main meals were a lot better. The penang particularly impressed although the massaman lacked a bit of flavour. I went for the chicken pad krapow which was disappointing.Service was very good so they get an extra star for that however it's not the cheapest and it's not the best. The only way I can sum up my experience is with a good old....It's OK

COp7KcmAdGCCVtk9So9qnQ.text: It's hard to miss this massive purple lit restaurant in old street. The ambience of this place is lovely and top table usually does really good offers here so definitely keep an eye for last minute bookings for large groups. There's a platter for starters that's great for sharing and the satay chicken is my favourite. For the mains I went for green curry with jasmine rice which was quite spicy but the flavours were quite nice but not sure about the authentic side. The meat here is halal so it's great for friends or family who have that dietary requirement. The staff are friendly, one girl said she literally just started today but she was very polite and helpful. It's not the best Thai place but it's good value for money, we had 40% off total bill from top table.

ofrUeUNrziLqa_23F9ommA.text: Expectations were low based on the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. We had great food and fast service. A lot of London Thai restaurants do not serve pad see ewe so we were happy to see that Thai Thai does! I hope the next time we visit we have the same pleasant experience.SATAY CHICKEN A famous skewered of chicken well marinated and char-grilled served with satay peanut sauce.PAD PO-TAK Stir-fried mixed seafood with lemon grass, chilli, garlic and basil leaves.TAO FU KHING Vegetarian DishA light dish stir-fried bean curd with shredded ginger, spring onion and mushrooms.PAD SEE IEW Stir fried flat noodles fried with soya sauce, broccoli and spring onion.Banana Fritter with honey and ice cream

m1f9YiCBnE5CJwYsBbAfHw.text: The chicken satay could have better and tom-yum soup needed perhaps less chilli.

03_6UlCFXWxgE5HB2ZO3vA.text: I was really pleasantly surprised by this spot. We had the £9 lunch deal with veggie potstickers and pad kee mao (the flat 'drunken' noodles I am now so obsessed with!)The noodles were particularly tasty and there was enough to take home for a mid-afternoon snack.  Lovely decor and interesting techno Indian music. Would return!

XRfPEULDH5mEkRl_XYy3Qw.text: The food here is fantastic. It is presented beautifully and tastes amazing.We had the meat platter for starters and loved it. We ate it between two of us but you could easily split it between three.We all enjoyed our main courses. I had the stir fry which came in a rich oyster sauce with prawns and coconut rice as was recommended on the menu. That rice stood out as the best thing of the night. Seriously. It was delicious.  Especially with the stir fry.The interior of the restaurant is pretty impressive and quite chic looking. You can tell some thought goes into presentation (of the food as well as the restaurant). It gives a good impression which the food lives up too! Only negative is that service was quite slow. Wouldn't stop me from going again though!

9NrPFR_VdNsRIn--MWrgew.text: I wanted to give this place more stars because the waitress who initially served us was lovely, we both ordered  Pad Thais one with prawns and the other mixed seafood. Although the flavors were ok the noodles were overcooked and just really average. The restaurant wasn't full and there were a lot of staff on but the service was painfully slow, with some waiters even walking right past customers trying to wave them down. The lighting was very dark with techno music playing too loudly for an evening meal. We wondered whether it turned into a nightclub after a certain hour? It has potential to be a really good restaurant, with a bit of an interior makeover (it was an odd mash of modern thai and 90s disco) and some focus on getting the basic thai dishes right.

49KVX-AGqGGtEiUSaoLM5g.text: Had a lovely meal here last night. Had read some mixed reviews so wasn't sure at first when a friend suggested it but we had a great experience! The food was cooked perfectly and the staff were really attentive. Our wine was lovely and served at perfect temperature and the waiters kept us topped up! I'd really recommend the pad kee maow. Everything was delicious and feasted light not oily. A great place to pop in to if you're in the area :)

UVGc1z5iUQ79cL5lUzqCUw.text: Went there with 4 other friends and booked a table for dinner earlier that morning to get 50% off the bill. During our booking, we strongly requested seats on the first floor. When we got there, the semi rude waitress told us that the first floor was full and have to bring us to the underground level- no bueno. The atmosphere is so much worst down at that little dungent. Awful. There were a wide variety of food on the menu. We each picked 2 dishes just to find out that the 50% off deal requires each customer to order one appetizer and a main. This really got on our nerves as it never says so online. We were each to order 2 dishes where the total would already cost more than app+main. One word - LAME. Appetizers were small and unfulfilling. Food came, salty as HELL. The river prawns were big but the spicy prawn dish was overly spicy and salty, and sweet. My friend's pad Thai was too sweet, and my other friend's pad see ew was too salty as well. The sea bass was TOO SALTY. It wasas if they sprinkled a jar of msg to flavor their dishes. The only good dish was the beef curry, which my friend gets every time she goes. Conclusion: nice atmosphere but dont be fooled folks!! skippable

P4fBHF_MBBaiE8gktesfIw.text: I suppose I had really low expectations of this place because 1) I was claiming the free meals using my toptable points and 2) not such great reviews.  I suppose I was pleasantly surprised because the selections available for the free meal was quite a lot.  We ordered the typical dishes - prawn toast, chicken satay and thai fish cakes.  For mains, chicken green curry, duck red curry and chicken pad thai.  All very well prepared and tasted good.  I'd definitely come back here.  Only thing that I didn't like was that it was really steamy.  Eventually they did open the door which made it less humid but I can't imagine what it would be like to sit in this restaurant during summer.
